Posted By: Pontiac (4/6/2011 11:50:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
+ it let's us play cards and ignore their color requirements  
+ it easily becomes out of hand once it starts going, be it with cards generating extra turns, drawing you more cards, returning cards from graveyard to hand or whatever  
+ you can play the mirror, and next time it triggers, in response to the trigger, you can activate it and imprint something. once the triggered effect of the mirror resolves, it will allow you to play the imprinted card, even though it was not yet imprinted when the trigger was put on the stack  
  
- doesnt work on spells with X in the cost  
- must trigger several times to be of use. if it triggers just once or not at all, you wasted cards and 5 mana  
- if it gets destroyed / bounced / stopped in any way, you lose two or more cards at once
posts.html:
+ it let's us play cards and ignore their color requirements
+ it easily becomes out of hand once it starts going, be it with cards generating extra turns, drawing you more cards, returning cards from graveyard to hand or whatever
+ you can play the mirror, and next time it triggers, in response to the trigger, you can activate it and imprint something. once the triggered effect of the mirror resolves, it will allow you to play the imprinted card, even though it was not yet imprinted when the trigger was put on the stack

- doesnt work on spells with X in the cost
- must trigger several times to be of use. if it triggers just once or not at all, you wasted cards and 5 mana
- if it gets destroyed / bounced / stopped in any way, you lose two or more cards at once

posts.post_content: @Tsuichoi: When the copy of [Time Reversal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Reversal) resolves, everybody shuffles and redraws their hand, and the copy of [Time Reversal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Reversal) is exiled, not the spell imprinted on the mirror. This occurs every turn, and would be incredibly fun in a giant group EDH game to get people on your side

Posted By: dingophone (11/18/2011 11:49:19 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Tsuichoi  
  
With [Time Reversal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Reversal) this card makes a copy that would exile itself at end of turn. Not that that really matters seeing as the copy would cease to exist regardless after its effect hit the field anyway. The only difference between a copy of Time Reversal and lets say [Timetwister](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timetwister) is that Time Reversal never hits the graveyard. So graveyard effects don't trigger from Time Reversal. While they still would from Timetwister. Once Timetwister would hit the graveyard though effects that work on a spell hitting the graveyard would still trigger before the copy would cease to exist.  
  
But I think what you really want to know is how Time Reversal works with this. And the answer to that is, just like any other card. Because it says You may **copy** one of the imprinted cards the fact that the copy exiles itself doesn't have an effect with the card except when you are dealing with graveyard triggers.  
  
I hope this helped you and I hope it wasn't ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Tsuichoi

With Time Reversal this card makes a copy that would exile itself at end of turn. Not that that really matters seeing as the copy would cease to exist regardless after its effect hit the field anyway. The only difference between a copy of Time Reversal and lets say Timetwister is that Time Reversal never hits the graveyard. So graveyard effects don't trigger from Time Reversal. While they still would from Timetwister. Once Timetwister would hit the graveyard though effects that work on a spell hitting the graveyard would still trigger before the copy would cease to exist.

But I think what you really want to know is how Time Reversal works with this. And the answer to that is, just like any other card. Because it says You may copy one of the imprinted cards the fact that the copy exiles itself doesn't have an effect with the card except when you are dealing with graveyard triggers.
